body_html:
This looks like it's been fixed.

I can saver.save and saver.restore a partitioned variable without trouble. If this is still a problem please post a minimal example of the code that is not working for you.

Interesting to note, your line:

softmax_w = tf.get_variable("softmax_w", [hps.vocab_size, hps.projected_size])

Fails for me with:

ValueError: No partitioner was provided, but a partitioned version of the variable was found:
softmax_w/part_0. Perhaps a variable of the same name was already created with partitioning?

body:
This looks like it's been fixed.

I can `saver.save` and `saver.restore` a partitioned variable without trouble. If this is still a problem please post a minimal example of the code that is not working for you.

Interesting to note, your line:

    softmax_w = tf.get_variable("softmax_w", [hps.vocab_size, hps.projected_size])

Fails for me with:

    ValueError: No partitioner was provided, but a partitioned version of the variable was found:
    softmax_w/part_0. Perhaps a variable of the same name was already created with partitioning?
